CPUProfiler Class Reference

#include <CPUProfiler.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The CPU profiler records and displays information about frames per second, CPU usage type distribution and other statistic information.

Definition at line 22 of file CPUProfiler.h.

enum  UsageType {
  OTHER = 0, GRAPHICS, IO, APPLICATION,
  IDLE, COUNT
}

Public Member Functions

 CPUProfiler ()
 Creates a new CPU profiler.

void drawProfile ()
 Renders the profile information on the desktop.

UsageType getUsageType ()
 Returns the currently set usage type.

void onFrame ()
 Notifies the profiler about a rendered frame (updates frame count).

void reset ()
 Resets all profiling information.

void setUsageType (UsageType usageType)
 Notifies the profiler about the beginning of a certain type of CPU usage (update usage type times).

 ~CPUProfiler ()
 Destroys the CPU profiler.


Protected Member Functions

void updateSamples ()
 Checks whether the current sample is over and shifts all samples accordingly.


Protected Attributes

unsigned long * averageUsageTime
 A temporary array of usage times when rendering the CPU profile.

Font * font
 The font usage for rendering profile information.

long * frameCounts
 An array of samples, each containing the number of frames rendered in that sample.

long samplesTaken
 The number of samples taken since the last call to reset().

unsigned long sampleStartTime
 The start time of the current sample.

unsigned long ** usageTimes
 An array of samples, each containing an array of CPU usage times, one for each usage type.

UsageType usageType
 The currently set usage type.

 The number of samples to remember.

 The number of milliseconds of one samples.

const unsigned long USAGE_COLORS [UsageType::COUNT]
 The colors for the usage types when rendering the CPU profile.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum UsageType
 

Enumeration values:
OTHER  The CPU has been used for other purposes than stated below.

GRAPHICS  The CPU has been used for graphics operations (e.g.

rendering).

IO  The CPU has been used for I/O communication (input devices, network, etc.).

APPLICATION  The CPU has been used by the application for various purposes.

IDLE  The CPU has been idle.

COUNT  The total number of different usage types.

const int SAMPLE_COUNT [static, protected]
 

The number of samples to remember.

The profiler will take the average of all samples in history when rendering the CPU profile.
